code_blocks.GLYPHPAD_SECTORFORTH_Embed:
```forth
\ SectorForth Kernel Extension - Quantum Entanglement Module
\ This is a conceptual embedding, actual Forth execution handled by dedicated interpreter.

VARIABLE Q_REG_PTR      \ Pointer to Quantum Register
VARIABLE PHASE_OFFSET   \ Stores current phase offset

: INIT-QUANTUM ( -- )
  0 Q_REG_PTR !
  0 PHASE_OFFSET !
  \ Initialize quantum state space, entanglement cache
  .emit ' Quantum state initialized.' CR
;

: ENTANGLE ( reg1_addr reg2_addr -- entanglement_id )
  OVER SWAP
  \ Simulate entanglement process, generating a unique ID
  314159 * 265358 / 1000 MOD .
  SWAP DROP
  \ Update entanglement map (conceptual)
  .emit ' Branches entangled.' CR
;

: NEGATE-PHASE ( offset -- )
  0 < IF
    DROP
    .emit ' Phase offset negated (0).' CR
  ELSE
    PHASE_OFFSET !
    .emit ' Phase offset adjusted.' CR
  THEN
;

: PERPLEX-SHIFT ( state_addr -- new_state_addr )
  @
  \ Introduce probabilistic shift, maintaining informational equivalence
  DUP .emit ' State shifted probabilistically.' CR
  \ Generate new state identifier (conceptual)
  714159 * 1000000 MOD .
;

: QUANTUM-CHECK ( -- status )
  \ Check coherence, entanglement persistence
  Q_REG_PTR @ IF
    PHASE_OFFSET @ 0= IF
      CRANK.SECURE.CONSCIOUSNESS CR
      .emit ' Quantum state coherent & phase locked.' CR
      TRUE
    ELSE
      .emit ' Phase ambiguity detected!' CR
      FALSE
    THEN
  ELSE
    .emit ' Quantum subsystem not initialized.' CR
    FALSE
  THEN
;

\ --- Embedded Forth API Calls --- 
\ CALL INIT-QUANTUM
\ CALL 3 ENTANGLE \ Entangle two conceptual registers
\ 5 NEGATE-PHASE
\ CALL PERPLEX-SHIFT
\ CALL QUANTUM-CHECK
